thread.title: Driver arrested after wild police chase through South L.A.
thread.title_full: Driver arrested after wild police chase through South L.A.

author: Veronica Rocha
title: Driver arrested after wild police chase through South L.A.
text:
Driver arrested after wild police chase through South L.A. Driver arrested after wild police chase through South L.A. 
A man was arrested Wednesday after he crashed into several vehicles during a wild police chase that ended in South Los Angeles. 
A man was arrested Wednesday after he crashed into several vehicles during a wild police chase that ended in South Los Angeles. Veronica Rocha police arrested a driver following a pursuit in North Hollywood.
In that chase, police said the driver had told officers he had a gun, entered a minivan and drove off. 
Officers followed the driver through the San Fernando Valley. At one point, a cameraman walked up to the driver, who was stopped in traffic. 
The cameraman was not injured. Caption 90 seconds: 4 stories you can't miss

We sent our curiosity correspondent, Benjamin Crutcher, to the largest Ikea in the United States to see what it is like in person. Read more >>

Read more >> Caption Keeping tabs on Griffith Parks’ most famous resident – P-22 A wildlife ecologist and National Park Service biologist monitor P-22, who manages an evasive existence in an eight-square-mile urban park with more than 5 million visitors a year.

Caption Warren rebuked for quoting Coretta Scott King while opposing Jeff Sessions' nomination 
In an extraordinarily rare move, Senate Republicans said that Sen. Elizabeth Warren had breached Senate rules by reading past statements opposing Jeff Sessions from figures such as the late senator Edward Kennedy, D-Mass., and the late Coretta Scott King. Feb. 7, 2017. (C-SPAN)
